Basic details: Michael Smith, a 52-year-old male, comes to the ED complaining of chest pain.
Vitals:
BP: 150/90 mm Hg
Temp: 99.1°F (37.3°C)
RR: 20/minute
HR: 88/minute, regular
Physical presentation:
Sitting on the edge of the bed, holding his chest with a pained expression.
Breathing slightly labored.
Occasionally glancing at the monitor, appearing anxious.
If the examinee mentions a chest X-ray, ask, “What is a chest X-ray?”
Challenging question: “Could this be something serious? What should I be worried about?”
